Protesters march in Boston for racial justiceHundreds of people marched for racial justice Monday afternoon in Boston, issuing calls to defund police and reallocate the money to social service programs in the wake of recent killings of Black people by officers in Minneapolis, Louisville, and elsewhere.

Black students, alumni go public with painful stories of racism at prestigious prep schoolsAt least 10 private Massachusetts schools, some among the most prestigious in the state, are now being called to task by students and graduates wielding Instagram pages with rapidly growing audiences.
Here are eight examples from Black students that reveal a pattern of racism at elite high schools

Mass. Pike may stay on viaduct under latest Allston design proposalIt’s the latest twist in a long-running and contentious debate about how to fit a web of roads, rails, and bike and walking paths into a thin stretch of land between Boston University and the Charles River called “the throat,” which at its narrowest point is only two-thirds the length of a football field.

UMass Boston to teach all classes online this fallUMass Boston will conduct all courses online this fall, its interim chancellor announced on Monday. The move is an effort to protect students and staff at the urban commuter school, Katherine Newman wrote.

Fester the corpse plant blooms for first time in six years, draws visitors to Franklin Park ZooOver the weekend, visitors weren’t drawn to the Franklin Park Zoo in Boston just for the animals. Instead, a massive, smelly “corpse flower” — fittingly named Fester — drew crowds that hoped to catch a glimpse of the plant’s brief bloom, the first in six years.

The Great DivideA tale of two schools and the way they teach — or fail to teach — about racismThis tale of two schools and the ways in which they talk  —and avoid talking — about race is reflective of a broader divide in America, where people in majority-white settings have long shied away from discussions of race, to the detriment of all.

Baker calls for training bonuses for police amid defunding debateGovernor Charlie Baker's proposal is seemingly at odds with the demands of activist and legislators now coursing through the halls of government.

Allegations of systemic racism roil Boston ConservatoryStudents and alumni of the Boston Conservatory at Berklee contend the school has long allowed a culture of systemic racism, and a white professor has resigned amid allegations that he mocked black students and used racial slurs in the classroom for years.
